config.question: Although the New Deal helped African Americans survive the Great Depression, what is the most likely reason why the topic of racial injustice was never comprehensively addressed by Roosevelt’s administration?

choices.content: Beginning in 1938, the Democratic party was dominated by southern conservatives.
The Roosevelt administration had very little sympathy for minority rights.
A lack of resources prompted Roosevelt to favor white Americans.
African Americans never really supported the Roosevelt administration.

answer_3.response: Consider This: A weakness of Roosevelt’s coalition is that it relied on southern Democrats that would never countenance social reform such as addressing minority civil rights. See L.O. 26.5 The New Deal’s End.
